clinical_study.brief_title: Investigating Social Competence in Youth With Autism
clinical_study.official_title: Investigating Social Competence in Youth With Autism: A Multisite Randomized Control Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Our treatment, SENSE Theatre, combines several well-documented, effective behavioral strategies and theatre techniques. The proposed project will extend previous findings showing improving improvement in memory for faces. The multisite randomized control trial will include a large sample of 240 children with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) randomly assigned to the experimental (SENSE Theatre) or an active control condition (Tackling Teenage Together).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to end of treatment (10 weeks).
primary_outcome.description: A measure of face memory following a delay. Possible score ranges from a scaled score of 1-19 with high scores reflecting better face memory.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidental Face Memory (IFM) Event-Related Potential (ERP) task
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to end of treatment (10 weeks).
primary_outcome.description: The IFM involves passive viewing of novel faces one of which repeats. The dependent measure is the difference in ERP amplitude of 250-500 ms time window between the repeated and single face presentation. Positive values indicate better face memory.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post-treatment (10 weeks), and two-month follow-up.
secondary_outcome.description: The SRS is a measure of social competence that is administered by parents pertaining to behaviors characteristic of children with autism. T scores range from 38-90 with higher scores reflecting more pathology.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post-treatment (10 weeks), and two-month follow-up.
secondary_outcome.description: The ABAS is a parental rating scale pertaining to various adaptive behaviors in a child, such as social and communication skills. Standard scores for the subscales range from 1 to 19. Higher scores reflect better skills in each domain.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post-treatment (10 weeks), and two-month follow-up.
secondary_outcome.description: The CASS is an observational measure of social interaction skills with two similar age peers. There are two conditions which include a Interested Condition and a Bored Condition. The behaviors will be coded based on raw scores from 1 to 7 with 7 reflecting better ability.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post-treatment (10 weeks), and two-month follow-up.
secondary_outcome.description: The CBCL is a parent report measure of a variety of symptom domains relevant for children with autism and related neurodevelopment disorders. T scores range from 40 to 100.

arm_group.description: SENSE Theatre is a peer-mediated, theatre-based intervention targeting social competence in youth with autism spectrum disorder. The 40 hour intervention is comprised of 10 sessions in which trained typically peers are paired with children with autism spectrum disorder (ASD).
The Tackling Teenage Together is a psychosocial and sexual education program developed for youth with ASD. It is comprised of 10 sessions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children with high-functioning ASD (IQ > or = to 70).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children who evidence aggression toward other people.
